revised_title: High-Temperature Structural Materials: Advances in Phase Diagram Calculations
tldr: This article discusses the advancements in phase diagram calculations for high-temperature structural materials, focusing on the CALPHAD method. It explains how these calculations can predict phase equilibria in multicomponent alloys with high accuracy, allowing engineers to model materials with confidence. The article also highlights the use of phase diagram calculations for predicting other properties, such as non-equilibrium solidification behavior, time-temperature-transformation diagrams, and antiphase domain boundary energies.
